intro: Cyphostemma cabui, commonly known as the African milk bush, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, simple leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by capsule fruits containing minute seeds. It is often found in rocky areas and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. The plant has been used traditionally for its medicinal properties, though its toxicity requires caution in use.
